transcript:
in him. "I don't under- stand," he said, "how it is that the mind of man cannot attain the knowledge of which you speak." 
The Mason smiled with his gentle fatherly smile. 
"The highest wisdom and truth are like the purest liquid we may wish to imbibe," he said. "Can I receive that pure liquid into an impure vessel and judge of its purity? Only by the in- ner purification of myself can I retain in some degree of purity the liquid I receive." 
"Yes, yes, that is so," said Pierre joyfully.
